Bottle from Bierzwerg!


Pours amber colored with nice off-white head. Smell has sweet malts, spicy. Starts sweet malty, spicy, with some floral hops. Finish is lovely malty and slight fruity.
Bottle. Malty, caramel and fruit notes, a slight candy sweetness. Full bodied and flavourful, pretty well balanced. Nice.
Pours with a heavy foam, beautiful color. Muted aromas. Tastes like an American ale, toasty, malty, not heavy on the alcohol. Great beer for tapas.

Pours a hazy copper gold with fluffy eggshell head. Aromas of caramels, toasted bread, and a touch of campfire smoke. Taste is of caramel malts without too much sweetness. Alcohol shows as it warms. Finishes with a light tang and a caramel flavors. Full bodied with a faint astringency.

Light fragrance of flowers. The taste is very bitter and fruity. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth a weak moment. For bitter beer for me to like it. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours brown. Aroma of red licorice, brown sugar, malt, molasses: nice. Tastes of the same: smooth and sweet. Lingering bittersweet aftertaste. Flavourful yet sessionable.

I could tell you about the aroma, the appearance the palate. But I wont waste your time: This was simply, the most delicious beer I have had the pleasure of drinking in a very, very long time. If I had the choice, I would drink nothing else. Spectacular work Rogue.

Pours a caramel color. Aroma is very sweet- caramel and toffee. Taste contains more bitter or dry elements than I would expect based on the coloration and taste, and I think that’s a good thing. Hops upfront quickly melt into a Werther’s original candy type taste that is sweet, but not overly sweet. I guess I’m a little picky in some respects for a guy who’ll drink adjunct lagers when finances dictate- I enjoy some malty beers, but when they taste a little too much like candy, that can be a turn-off, and when they get a little too roasted and burnt, that can be a turn-off. This definitely is not the latter. It has some aspects of the former, but skirts the line nicely with the upfront hoppiness and not overdoing it on the backend sweetness despite the base backend flavor being similar to beers that cross the line. I would say a good beer, but not spectacular.  Nicely avoids some common pitfalls, but it’s aim isn’t to the side of the bock equation I’d aim for.  I think I would raise my rating a lot if it were only relative to beers that smell and somewhat taste like candy.  But in a world where not all beers do, just a solid beer (Which is nothing to sneeze at).

Amber with a small white head. Aroma is bread, biscuit, caramel, honey, bananas, apples, oranges. Taste is malty, citric, fruity, grassy and light alcohol presence. Sweet and light alcoholic aftertaste. Warming mouthfeel.

355ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Small tan head. Hazy light amber body with quite a bit of sediments. Low carbonation. Aroma is mostly earthy yeast and marmelade. Rich malt body. Slightly bitter on the tongue at first with a sour/sweet finish. Slightly spicy.

355ml bottle at Van Zanten. Hazy amber with a medium slightly off-white head. Medium body with low carbonation. Nice sweetness with some bitter tones. Malts, caramel, honey, raisin and herbs. Quite a tasty brew.

pours a light copper with a medium beige head. aroma of grass/hay and malt. Nice malty taste. Some mild hop bitter arrives in the middle and goes into a pleasant hop presence on the finish. Not syrupy like many bocks. A really good balanced beer.
Pours with almost no head. More on the malt (caramel, nutty feel) side but with a nice touch of extra hops in the end which is a bit unusual for this style (but expected considering it s made in USA)

Aroma is strongly malty with notes of marmelade, fruits, raisin and slight vanilla. Mouthfeel is nice and slick with a medium amount of carbonation. The flavor is definately malty, sweet and marmelade-ish with some butterscotch and vanilla. Finish has some slight spice, probably from the hops. Definately a really nice beer!
Bottle. Orange-amber color. Aroma: toffee, plum, jam, caramel a bit of marsala. Taste malty, honey, some wine, hop bitterness in finish.

Small off-white head; medium to dark Amber color; just a bit hazy.

Malt dominates with molasses and bread aromas; some hop balance though with some mild grass aroma.

Medium to full body; texture a bit oily and creamy. Long finish with moderate to heavy sweetness and bitterness.
Bottle at home. Pours reddish amber, nose is caramel, fruity, taste is malty, toffee, caramel, raisin.
Bottle. caramel, earthy, alcohol, raisin, black currant, vanilla, butterscotch, amber color, cloudy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness. medium body, creamy, soft carbonation.
Wow. Quiet, calm, refreshing. Nothing unwanted upfront, nor aftertaste. I might be giving this more credit cause it is Oregon Craft.
